title: Circular motion - change in speed and orbit

content.question: A satellite orbits Earth in a circle of radius <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math> with speed <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math>. The satellite is then moved into a new circular orbit with radius <math alttext="3 R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mi>R</mi></math>. What tangential speed must the satellite have in order to maintain the new orbit?

choices.label: <math alttext="the square root of 3 v, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msqrt><mn>3</mn><mi>v</mi></msqrt></math>
<math alttext="the fraction v over the square root of 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>v</mi><msqrt><mn>3</mn></msqrt></mfrac></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction v over the square root of 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>v</mi><msqrt><mn>3</mn></msqrt></mfrac></math>
